message.content:
cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.NE, cs.CV

This paper is about improving the ability of semantic reasoning over sentence pairs, which is a core task in natural language understanding. Therefore, the most likely category is cs.CL (Computation and Language). The paper also proposes a modification to the BERT model, which is a popular deep learning model for natural language processing, indicating that the paper could also belong to cs.LG (Machine Learning) or cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence). Additionally, the paper involves label smoothing, which is a common technique in neural network training, suggesting that it could also belong to cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing). Finally, the paper evaluates its proposed method on natural language inference and machine reading comprehension benchmarks, which are tasks related to text understanding and interpretation, indicating that it could also belong to cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition).
